job_title: Digital Development Officer in Manhattan, KS
cons: Non Profit red tape will hinder some workflow

job_title: Director of Development in Manhattan, KS
pros: Great coworkers who truly care about each other. Leadership is focused on giving team members a good career experience, while balancing the demanding world of fundraising goals. K-State donors are absolutely the best to work with, very generous people who truly care about making K-State a great University.
cons: As of 2022 going through internal leadership transitions and K-State has hired a new University President. Leading to some uncertainty among the team and donors.

review_title: Used to be good, but not any longer
pros:
Personal time off (vacation and sick)
Retirement
Swag
Work/life balance
Great staff
cons:
Management has turned against staff during covid. No longer willing to listen to staff needs/desires. Foundation is hemorrhaging staff, but management is blind.

Foundation had a great year, working from home, but it goes against upper management wishes, and now we all pay the price.

Used to be a great place to work, but now avoid at all costs.

Stack ranking performance, everyone for themselves. Has become less and less transparent over the years. Management actively downgrades staff so they can get better raises.

Diversity and other woke themes are taking on a greater and greater role, instead of serving our higher purpose, fund raising for KSU.
It is a great place to work, hard to find a con

job_title: Director of Stewardship in Manhattan, KS
pros: Opportunity for growth in the organization, making a difference for the university, striving to do the next big thing.
cons: In the big picture, there isn't one.

pros: Yes this is a good place
cons: No, this is not a bad place

job_title: Assistant Director of Development in Manhattan, KS
pros: Fantastic benefits and Co-workers that are mission driven with work life balance opportunities
cons: Certain development leadership has been difficult to work for. More than a few of left in the last 1.5 years.

job_title: Research Analyst in Kansas City, MO
pros: fairness for work. freedom in job

pros: Great people to work with internally, people are happy to be there and like to work collaboratively. Externally K-State Alumni and Donors are fantastic, excited to give back and have the capacity to do so.
cons: The grass is very green at the KSU Foundation but the water bill is also high. Clear measurable productivity goals and accountability. Not a place to coast.

pros: Benefits, Ability to Travel, Very Big Supporters of Professional Development
cons: Promotions can be limited, Rampant Favoritism

pros: It was great to work with a group of people that seem to genuinely care about each other. The sense of community is strong. Time off is generous.
cons: The opportunity for vertical movement can be limited, depending on the department.

job_title: Gift Processing Coordinator in Manhattan, KS
pros: Beautiful facility, friendly management, decent pay, close to the K-State family
cons: Limited upward mobility for non-fundraising personnel

pros: Challenging, goal-oriented environment committed to success.
